title: Grazing and Haying Cover Crops with Josh Roe

tasks.task: Planting cover crops for grazing and hay production in agriculture
subtasks: Selecting appropriate cover crop seeds (oats, spring field peas, radishes, turnips, and forage sorghum)
Custom drilling the seed mix at a cost of $17.59 per acre
Applying additional chemicals (roundup burn down) at a cost of $15.59 per acre
Timing planting for mid-August to take advantage of potential rain
Managing haying operations, including swathing, baling, and testing feed quality
Calculating net income from hay production considering prices and costs
Turning cattle out for grazing and monitoring daily gains
Calculating feed efficiency and cost per pound of gain for grazing cattle
Assessing soil health impacts from cover crops, including erosion prevention and weed suppression
Evaluating long-term benefits from cover crop rotations through regular soil sampling
